text: The equivalent teeth shrew mole (Uropsilus aequodonenia) is a species of mammal in the family Talpidae. It is endemic to Sichuan, China. It is characterized by having nine teeth in the row above and nine teeth in the lower row. The data indicate that it is the sister taxon of U. andersoni. Its specific name, aequodonenia, means 'equivalent teeth' in Latin.Liu Yang, Liu Shaoying, Sun Zhiyu, Guo Peng, Fan Zhenxin, Robert W. Murphy. «A new species of Uropsilus (Talpidae: Uropsilinae) from Sichuan, China». Acta Theriologica Sinica, vol. 33, 2, 2013, pàg. 113-122. ==References== Category:Mammals of China Category:Talpidae Category:Mammals described in 2013
title: Equivalent teeth shrew mole
